intro: Derris brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed derris, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the legume or bean family. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, compound leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in racemes, and it produces pods containing small, round seeds. Derris brevipes is notable for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of the alkaloid rotenone.
